Module kivakit.serialization.core
Package com.telenav.kivakit.serialization.core

Interface SerializationSession

All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable, Broadcaster, Closeable, Flushable, Listener, Named, NamedObject, Receiver, Repeater, SerializationSessionReadWrite, Transceiver, Transmitter, Versioned
All Known Implementing Classes:
KryoSerializationSession
public interface SerializationSession extends SerializationSessionReadWrite, Named, Closeable, Flushable, Versioned, Repeater
A high-level abstraction for serialization. This interface allows the serialization of VersionedObjects, during a bracketed serialization session. This design provides ease-of-use while ensuring that all serialized objects as well as the serialization stream itself are assigned a version.

Creating a Session

The method SerializationSessionFactory.session(Listener) can be called to obtain a SerializationSession instance.

Opening a Session

A serialization session is initiated by calling open(Type, Version, InputStream, OutputStream), after which versioned objects can be then read with read() and written with write(VersionedObject).

Example

 var serialization = threadSerialization();
 serialization.startSession(Type.RESOURCE, input, output);
 serialization.write(new VersionedObject<>("hello"));
 serialization.endSession();
Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
See Also:
SerializationSessionFactory, VersionedObject, Version

      default Version open​(SerializationSession.Type type, Version version, Socket socket, ProgressReporter reporter)

      Opens the given socket for reading and writing. Version handshaking is performed automatically for SerializationSession.Type.SERVERs and SerializationSession.Type.CLIENTs with the version of the connected endpoint returned to the caller.

    • open

      Version open​(SerializationSession.Type type, Version version, InputStream input, OutputStream output)
      Opens this session for reading and writing. Retains the given input and output streams for future use, and performs version handshaking per the SerializationSession.Type parameter.
      Returns:
      The resource, client or server version, or an exception
